node.title: After a terrible car crash, doctors told Anjali she'd never graduate from uni as a vet. This week she did just that
node.alt: An image of Anjali Krishnaa Warrier in a hospital bed with her family next to her
node.description: The near-fatal smash left Anjali with a broken back and brain injury, enough to kill off her lifelong ambition. But through her painful recovery, a memory kept her going.Â
node.content:
["On the last day of her placement in New Zealand,\u00a0Anjali Krishnaa Warrier remembers getting in the car and sitting next to her friend \u2014 but her memory ends there.", "As the car took\u00a0a corner,\u00a0it rolled multiple times\u00a0and, when it finally stopped,\u00a0the other passengers couldn't see the second-year University of Queensland (UQ) veterinary student.", "They got out of the car and found Ms Warrier near the wheel. She had suffered, they would learn later, two broken vertebrae, a fractured pelvis, a severed artery and a traumatic brain injury.", "From the accident scene in a remote area near Queenstown, her friends ran 20 kilometres in the middle of the night to find help at a farmhouse, following\u00a0the light of the farmer's television.", "It was the start of a long and difficult journey and, to help\u00a0her through the hardest days, she\u00a0dreamt of completing her studies and graduating as a veterinarian.", "", "
Ms Warrier\u00a0says she never doubted she would graduate, despite her terrible injuries.(Supplied:\u00a0Anjali Krishnaa Warrier\u00a0)
", "
'I could recognise people but I couldn't remember'
", "Ms Warrier was placed in a\u00a0coma for two weeks and was in intensive care for 34 days.", "Two months later she found herself in a Melbourne hospital.", "\"I can't remember any of that,\" she said.", "\"It's amazing I was responsive. I had a tracheostomy and I could recognise people but I couldn't remember.", "\"It's very funny \u2014 I put on weight after I moved to Australia in 2013 \u2014 and I felt like, when I woke up, that I'd lost a lot of weight.", "But Ms Warrier then had to learn to walk and talk again\u00a0and to overcome her memory loss.", "
Doctors ruled out return to study
", "Doctors told Ms Warrier's parents that her injuries were so severe\u00a0she would be unable to return to university to finish her veterinary degree.", "But after two years of recovery, hard work and determination, Ms Warrier was allowed to recommence her studies.", "", "
The UQ student is inspired by people and animals.(Supplied: Anjali Krishnaa Warrier)
", "\"In 2018 I was approved to go back to third year,\" she said.", "\"My memory was pathetic but I passed.\u00a0I'm so grateful I did.\u00a0I have no idea how I did.", "\"It was very exciting.\"", "
Inspiration sparked at a young age
", "Ms Warrier was inspired to become a vet because of her \"uncle\", a close family friend who had a veterinary practice underneath their family home in India.", "\"As long as I can remember I was coming home to a vet clinic, so it's always been my dream,\" she said.", "", "
Anjali Krishnaa Warrier has always dreamed of being a vet.(Supplied: Anjali Krishnaa Warrier)
", "Memories of her uncle's practice and that long-held goal made it easier to work towards her ambition after the accident.", "\"He's my biggest inspiration for studying vet, and in 2019 he was diagnosed with cancer, and that was the moment, my turning point, where I thought,\u00a0'Now I'm going to work really hard\u00a0and make sure I can graduate in 2021 to make sure he can be there',\" she said.", "Sadly, her \"uncle\"\u00a0died in November 2019. But Ms Warrier kept working towards her dream and graduated from UQ this week.", "", "
Visualising herself in a mortarboard and gown during her painful recovery\u00a0helped Ms Warrier\u00a0achieve that reality this week.\u00a0(Supplied: Anjali Krishnaa Warrier)
", "She kept an image of herself in a mortarboard and university gown\u00a0stuck to a wall at home as motivation, and kept a daily countdown to the 2021 graduation ceremony.", "She saw the pandemic, despite face-to-face learning disruptions, as an opportunity, and turned what was normally a three-hour daily commute to and from the Gatton campus into study time.\u00a0", "\"I put in a lot of hard work, I expected and believed it would happen.\"", "
Family apart for five years to support recovery
", "After the crash, Ms Warrier's mother moved to Australia to help her daughter recover and has been living apart from her husband for five years.", "\"My parents have been immense \u2026 I couldn't have done it without them\u00a0and my friends, family, neighbours, random people \u2014\u00a0so, so many people,\" Ms Warrier said.", "\"I'm so grateful for the help.", "\"The other thing I always think is that you've got to see the invisible to achieve the impossible.\"", "To mark the celebration with her peers this week, she gave each of the graduating class a book that helped motivate and inspire her \u2014 The Happiness Advantage, by Shawn Achor \u2014 with a hand-written message inside.", "", "
Anjali gave her peers a copy of the book that helped motivate her during her recovery and final years of study.\u00a0\u00a0
", "\"I want to make a difference in people's lives because God's been very good to me.\""]
